item.title: Time Series
item.description: The last way of visually representing data is through a time series plot. A time series plot displays values against time. They are similar to x-y graphs, but while an x-y graph can plot a variety of “x” variables (for example, height, weight, age), timeplots can only display time on the x-axis. Unlike pie charts and bar charts, these plots do not have categories. Timeplots are good for showing how data changes over time.
